page.title: 11THE INTERIOR OF HONING HALL
page.content: On March 5th.,1985,we visited Honing Hall the home of Mr.and Mrs. Cubitt. It is not open to the public. On entering the Hall we firstly descended some stone steps to the cellars. Some wine is kept down there, but the cellars are mainly used for the storing of old furniture, like a 'slipper' bath, and garden furniture and sporting equipment. On the ground floor is the kitchen, entrance hall, dining room, living room and study, and housekeeper's quarters.We saw the bell system once used to summon servants to all manner of rooms. On the first floor was a splendid library and bedrooms, with bedrooms on the second floor and servants quarters on the very top floor.We saw items connected with the mailing of letters from the hall, portraits of the family's ancestors and militaria.
